title: Chapter 1: Mastering the Art of Effective Technical Writing
text:
Learning Objectives
After studying this chapter you should be able to:

Prepare an academic report or paper or document using all-powerful tools in the home, insert, layout, and references tabs
Efficiently design and format a long document
Avoid manual formatting by using styles
Automate references, captions, list of tables and figures, table of content

title: Application of Computer Technology and Document Processing in Forestry Management
text:
Outline
Application of Computer Technology and Document Processing in Forestry Management emphasizes learning data analysis techniques using programming routines and prepare professional documents using efficient tools. This book aims to equip students with a solid foundation in computer literacy, document processing, and data handling, using popular software tools such as MS Word, MS Excel, R, RStudio, R Markdown, and QGIS. Through reading this book, students will be able to:

Be proficient in document processing using powerful tools on MS Word

Prepare an academic report or paper or document using powerful tools
Efficiently design and format a long document: avoid manual formatting, use styles, references, layout, etc.

Be proficient in data handling and summarizing using powerful tools on MS Excel

Perform basic calculations (using formulas and functions) and interpret the results
Create and interpret basic graphs
Generate and interpret pivot tables and pivot charts

Perform data handling and analysis in RMarkdown statistical packages

Import/export data
Perform basic calculations
Create high-quality graphs

Manage and analyze geodata in QGIS

Create projects and organize geodata
Perform basic functionality and geoprocessing functions


By the end of this book, students will have a strong foundation in computer literacy and data handling that they can use in their academic and professional pursuits.

Version history
Materials were prepared for this book at the Faculty of Forestry, University of British Columbia, August 14, 2023.
